meanings.definition: Cry out suddenly in surprise, anger, or pain.
meanings.sent1: She would exclaim when she saw a spider.
meanings.sent2: He would often exclaim when startled.
meanings.sent3: The cat would exclaim at the sight of a cucumber.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to exclaim its power.
meanings.sent5: Her exclaim echoed through the empty hallway.

meanings.sent1: He would exclaim his disagreement during meetings.
meanings.sent2: She would exclaim her excitement when talking about her favorite book.
meanings.sent3: The toddler would exclaim his demands for more cookies.
meanings.sent4: The politician seemed to exclaim his promises to the crowd.
meanings.sent5: His exclaim filled the room with passion.
